author: yuga.eth
content:
Hi folks - is there anywhere one can find an exhaustive list of the new JSON RPC API changes/additions related to 1559 and its prerequisites (e.g. 2718)? 

<@!574864862338088960> I saw https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3041 but it wasn't clear to me how I could find all of them

author: timbeiko
content:
<@!829793517378863164> there are a few listed here: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/blob/master/Fee-Market/mainnet-readiness.md#testing

The full set isn't done yet, but you can expect anything that returns a block or transaction to include the 1559 parameters

author: timbeiko
content:
With regards to prerequisites, 1559 lists them on the EIP itself, in the `Requires` section: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1559

The two prerequisites are 2718 and 2930, which are both introduced in Berlin. In short, 1559 transactions are 2718-style txns, and can have 2930-style access lists

author: yuga.eth
content: Thanks, that link is super helpful! I think my main question is around the 2718 transaction objects and their key names, since we want to start coding against them even if the nodes are not yet returning them. (For example, will the object returned by eth_getTransactionByHash have a "type" field? And how will it be encoded?)

author: timbeiko
content: That's definitely a question for one of the devs and not me ðŸ˜… I suspect someone will answer over the next day or so!
